meanings.sent1: The rainy day made everything look drab and gloomy.
meanings.sent2: The room was painted in a drab color, making it seem unexciting.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations were so drab that even the balloons looked sad.
meanings.sent4: Her drab mood matched the gray clouds hanging low in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The drab landscape seemed to drain all color from the world.

meanings.sent1: She painted her walls in a drab that resembled dried leaves.
meanings.sent2: The old uniform was a shade of drab that blended into the background.
meanings.sent3: The drab of the carpet reminded him of the desert sand.
meanings.sent4: The drab of the curtains gave the room a sense of warmth.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's uniform was a perfect match for the drab of the battlefield.

meanings.definition: To make something dull or uninteresting
meanings.sent1: The long lecture managed to drab even the most enthusiastic students.
meanings.sent2: She tried to drab up the report with colorful charts and graphs.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to drab down the exciting story only made it more intriguing.
meanings.sent4: The artist refused to drab her painting, wanting to keep it vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's jokes had the power to drab up even the dullest of topics.
